Fourth quarter claim - Claim evidence

We require evidence of your costs (invoices/payslips etc.) and matched evidence of your payment of these costs (Bank and/or bacs statements/Credit card statements etc.)

Upload all your evidence files in support of this claim.
  • Each individual file shouldn’t be larger than 10MB.
  • We’ll check each file for viruses and notify you of any problems.
  • Preferred file types : pdf, jpg, png.

Supporting files

See examples

Period 1 - May-17

Bank statements

Bank statements must show transaction dates, amounts and payees that match other evidence, such as invoices, salary payments or receipts.
Help

Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

For a bank statement to be fully compliant as evidence of payment, it must:

  • Be a formal statement (either paper copy or online printout), not simply a transaction listing
  • Clearly show the bank name, address and logo
  • Clearly show the account holder's name and details
  • Clearly show relevant transaction dates, amounts and payees that correspond to other evidence, such as invoices, salary payments or receipts.

Example:

Bacs statements

Bacs statements must show individual salary payments. If you don't use Bacs, include output from your payroll system that lists individual salary payments.
Help

If the costs you are claiming appear as part of a single bulk Bacs payment on your bank statement (for example, as 'Payroll'), then you must submit a Bacs transaction list,as well as a bank statement as evidence of payment. Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

The Bacs transaction list must:

  • Be clearly identifiable as coming from your payment or payroll system
  • Clearly show individual payees, payment amounts and dates

Example:

Please note: The total payment sum and payment date on the transaction list must match the amount and date that appears on your bank statement. Any transactions not relevant to your claim can be redacted (obscured or scored through).

Payslips

Payslips must cover the whole period you are claiming for. For example, if this is a quarterly claim, you must include three month's payslips.
Help

For projects part-funded by the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF) Programme 2014-2020, you can only claim the salaries of staff who work 100% of their time on approved projects. Paragraph 3.3 of your contract will confirm if your project is ESIF funded or not.
Please note: you can only claim for gross/basic pay; other payments, such as commission or bonuses, cannot be included.

For each individual salary you claim, you must submit:

  • An employee job description, plus a signed letter from an authorised accountable officer confirming that 100% of this employee's time was spent working on the project.
  • Individual wage slips, or a company payroll listing, which must clearly show the cost breakdown of each individual salary being claimed.

Example:

Payslips

Payslips must cover the whole period you are claiming for. For example, if this is a quarterly claim, you must include three month's payslips.
Help
For projects part-funded by the European Structural and Investment Funds (ESIF) Programme 2014-2020, you can only claim the salaries of staff who work 100% of their time on approved projects. Paragraph 3.3 of your contract will confirm if your project is ESIF funded or not.
Please note: you can only claim for gross/basic pay; other payments, such as commission or bonuses, cannot be included.

For each individual salary you claim, you must submit:

  • An employee job description, plus a signed letter from an authorised accountable officer confirming that 100% of this employee's time was spent working on the project.
